msContents.summary: An extract copied out of a royal ordinance upon slaves, for use or for reference in the Fayum. It deals solely with the sales of slaves and the relations between the farmers of the slave sale tax and the tax payers. This document deals with the taxes on transfers of slaves, not on the ownership of them

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers in a professional hand which accentuates the top of each line
33 lines of writing in 2 cols.; the second col. only has 4 lines

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in December 1926; no. 55 in Bell

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Dicaearchus, -- Aetolian mercenary leader in the service of Ptolemy V

listBibl.bibl: P.Col. I inv. 480 Remarks and corrections in lines 23-24 and 27 in BL III p. 41; about line 25, BL IV p. 17; about publications speaking of this papyrus, cf. BL V p. 23; BL VI p. 30; BL VII p. 38; about line 16, BL VIII p. 87; about line 25, see BL IX p. 59; reprinted by R. Scholl, Corpus der Ptolemaischen Sklaventexte (1990) no. 5; correction in BL XI p. 61.
